technology: There were no technical difficulties experienced by the participant.
cur_neg_affect: The participant expresses some mild negative affect regarding the current state of vaccinations and how it's become more commonplace, but it's not a strong negative feeling.
past_neg_affect: The participant describes the past as 'traumatic' and expresses fear and anxiety related to the pandemic, especially concerning her partner's father's illness and returning to teaching.
communal_orientation: The participant actively listens, shows concern for the conversation partner's experiences, and shares similar experiences to build rapport.
engagement: The participant is highly engaged, asking follow-up questions, sharing her own experiences, and actively participating in the conversation.
defensiveness: The participant does not display any defensiveness in justifying her beliefs or perspective.
questions: (03:20) What was your pandemic experience like?
(09:59) What was your backseat experience like?
(12:54) Do you have any symptoms, or was your experience different?
(15:05) How do you feel about your whole experience getting vaccinated? Boosted, etc.
(16:00) I'm wondering what your decisions around vaccination are going to be in the near future. After our conversation today.
perspective_statements: (07:54) Yeah, thank you for sharing. That sounds incredibly, emotionally difficult and taxing.
(07:56) I'm so glad you're partner's. That was my! Father is okay.
similarity_statements: (03:23) So similarly, when we first kind of started hearing about cases in China, and Italy, I was a teacher at the time, and people were starting to float around.
(10:02) So it was I also, I similarly felt, very hopeful when they started to roll the vaccines out.
(12:11) Yeah, and I think that's really interesting. I agree. I guess I've seen that in my life, too.
(14:46) Absolutely. I agree with you there. I had a very similar experience in terms of you know, my personal piece in terms of being vaccinated, and all of that.
vaccine_importance: The participant expresses that vaccines brought her peace of mind and reduced anxiety, indicating a high level of importance.
booster_importance: The participant is considering holding off on the fourth booster but will continue to monitor the situation, suggesting that boosters are still somewhat important to her, but less so than the initial vaccines.
cognitive_complexity: The participant demonstrates cognitive complexity by acknowledging differing opinions on vaccines, reflecting on the changing perceptions of vaccines over time, and considering the impact of vaccines on her own health and well-being.
general_notes: The participant experienced the pandemic in New York City and had a partner whose father was severely ill with COVID. She is a teacher and was among the first to get vaccinated. She expresses a mix of hope and anxiety related to the pandemic and vaccines.
